text: hi my name is Rebecca and in today's
lesson we're going to talk about the
difference between two little words ago
and before because many students confuse
the two and sometimes use it in the
wrong way let's look at the first
example okay 20 years ago for example we
could say John moved to Canada 20 years
ago that would be the correct use of the
word ago to describe how long it has
been since something happened correct
so John moved to Canada 20 years ago the
mistake that is sometimes made by
students is that instead of saying 20
years ago they say 20 years before now
that would not be right what would be
right is if you said for example John
moved to Canada 20 years before I did
right you could add something and then
using before would be correct but if
you're saying only that much then you
say John move to Canada 20 years ago
alright or John graduated from
university five months ago right
not John graduated from university five
months before because by itself we can't
use before you could say John graduated
from University five months before I did
right or I left the house ten minutes
ago
that means it has been 10 minutes since
I left the house correct but you could
not say you should not say I left the
house 10 minutes before by itself that
would be incorrect you could say I left
the house 10 minutes before my son did
right so this is the little difference
between a go and before quite important
very common mistake so if you're making
it don't feel bad you're not alone it is
a mistake that is made by many students
but hopefully after this lesson you've
had a little chance to think about it
and see how best to structure the use of
these two words okay so if you have any
questions about this or anything else to
do with English please feel free to
write to us at wwm vidcom thanks very
much good luck with your English bye for
now
